newsitem.title: USA: Karpan wins Democratic primary for Wyoming senate.
newsitem.headline: Karpan wins Democratic primary for Wyoming senate.

text.p: A Wyoming state senator won a nine-way race Tuesday for the Republican nomination for the U.S. Senate seat being vacated by Republican Alan Simpson.

Mike Enzi, former mayor of the northeastern town of Gillette, gained 32 percent of the vote to edge second-place finisher John Barrasso, an orthopedic surgeon who won 30 percent. Seven other candidates trailed.

Enzi will face Democrat Kathy Karpan, who won 85 percent of the vote to defeat Mickey Kalinay, a University of Wyoming student. Kalinay said he entered the race to promote his idea to build a 22,000-mile high tower in space.

Karpan, a popular former two-term secretary of state, lost a gubernatorial bid when Republicans swept all state offices in 1994. Wyoming has not had a Democratic U.S. senator since Gale McGee lost his contest for a fourth term in 1976.
The popular Simpson is retiring after three terms on Capitol Hill.
